arm_group.description: Platelet function will be documented during the first 48 hours of veno-venous hemofiltration using the Multiplate system.

brief_summary.textblock:
Aim of the study is a description of changes in platelet function during continuous
      veno-venous hemodialysis or hemofiltration in patients on an intensive care unit using the
      Multiplate system.

clinical_study.brief_title: Monitoring Platelet Function During Continuous Hemodialysis
clinical_study.condition: Changes in Platelet Function During Hemofiltration.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Need for a continuous renal replacement therapy

          -  Platelet Count >100.000/nl

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Pregnancy

          -  Age <18 years

          -  Renal replacement therapy within the 7 days prior to enrollment

study_pop.textblock: Patients in an intensive care unit with the need for a renal replacement therapy-

clinical_study.official_title: Changes in Platelet Function During Continuous Veno-venous Hemodialysis Using the Multiplate Device

other_outcome.description: Age of the patient at the point of enrollment
Height of the patient measured in centimeters.
Weight of the patient measured in kilograms.
The ASA-Classification will be determined preoperatively.
Antiaggregatory medication taken prior to enrollment wil be recorded in the categories aspirin, clopidogrel, ticagrelor, cumarins and others.
The brand of filter used for the hemofiltration or hemodialysis will be registered.
The anticoagulation used for hemofiltration will be recorded in the categories heparin and calcium citrate.

primary_outcome.description: Area under the aggregation curve (AUC) after platelet stimulation with arachidonic acid at baseline and 6, 12, 24 and 48 hours after the start of the continuous hemofiltration.

reference.citation: Daugirdas JT, Bernardo AA. Hemodialysis effect on platelet count and function and hemodialysis-associated thrombocytopenia. Kidney Int. 2012 Jul;82(2):147-57. doi: 10.1038/ki.2012.130. Epub 2012 May 16. Review.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Area under the aggregation curve (AUC) after platelet stimulation with adenosine diphosphate at baseline and 6, 12, 24 and 48 hours after the start of the continuous hemofiltration.

Area under the aggregation curve (AUC) after platelet stimulation with thrombin-receptor-activating peptide 6 (TRAP-6) at baseline and 6, 12, 24 and 48 hours after the start of the continuous hemofiltration.

Clotting time (CT) in the intrinsically activated rotational thrombelastometry (ROTEM) recorded in seconds at baseline and 6, 12, 24 and 48 hours after the start of continuous veno-venous hemofiltration.

Maximum clot firmness (MCF) in the intrinsically activated rotational thrombelastometry (ROTEM) recorded in millimeters at baseline and 6, 12, 24 and 48 hours after the start of continuous veno-venous hemofiltration.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
